page.title: 10 BETLEY CRICKET CLUB
page.content: Betley Cricket Club was founded in 1880 and the pavillion was built in 1947 and the later one was built in 1970. The cricket pitch is about 2.5 to 3 acres.The square measures 37 by 37 metres.Mr Madden,the present chairman, has played cricket since 1948 but left for 2 years to play for Wrinehill. The grass on the cricket pitch is cut and rolled once every week by the club members.Mr Vernon Owen is the president,David Kennedy is the secretary and his wife is the treasurer. In the early 1900's J.Amps was a good cricketer and in recent years Roy Viccars has been good aswell.Martin Jervis is the captain of the 1st team. The 1st team plays in the North Staffs and south cheshire league and the 2nd team plays in the Kidsgrove league.
